title: Silent Hill playthrough â€” Part 3
description: The end. Super fun game, loved the puzzles and I liked that it had more action than I expected. The story is bizarre and interesting, the atmosphere is incredible, sound design is great. I can see why so many people love this game. Can't wait to play the 2nd one.

My favourite part of this graphics style is the texturing -- often they had to use affine transforms rather than perspective correct transforms for speed (but then did a whole ton of tricks to make them not distort too bad)
gettin the succ from bearclaw babby
pogo laying down the game dev knowledge
like we all know opengl over here
It's true... it accidentally adds a ton of character, and it's very fitting with the themes of this game
Lol sorry, I didn't mean to get too technical
we do all know OpenGL here
Haha phew, I had a feeling!
I thought it had to do with the PS1 not having 3D chip?
I'm starting to appreciate these old ass textures/models from PS1 era
as long as they aren't blurred all to hell with aliasing
i like the speedrun glitch here
and nah I mean the old blocky models too

@ProtoAus It did have a graphics chip that supported a lot, but it didn't support the typical 3D functionality that you see today. It only had hardware support for affine texture mapping (for texturing 3d), so it was way faster to use that than roll your own solution

Because affine texture mapping isn't correct for 3D (lines are always parallel, rather than move towards a fixed perspective point), they had to use all sorts of tricks to make things not distort as much as they could
